svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
September 14, 2024" date: "2024-09-14"
Eth News and Links
Danny Ryan taking indefinite break, Pectra upgrade split proposed & cbBTC live
All core devs
* All Core Devs - Execution (ACDE) #196 : Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade: Pectra
split proposed : overall scope to remain the same, cap Pectra at devnet-3 spec to
target Q1 2025, second upgrade with PeerDAS & EOF to target H2 2025, agree split at
ACDC Pectra-devnet-3 : live, validator consolidations & EIP7702 work as expected and
wallet devs can use to test EIP7702 EIP7685 execution layer requests : explicit
ordering & handling of invalid requests to be specified EIP7702 : minimal validity
checks, inline with existing transaction types EIP2537 BLS precompile: MSM precompiles
need benchmarking with concurrency disabled to see if gas cost should be doubled
* Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade: Pectra split proposed : overall scope to remain
the same, cap Pectra at devnet-3 spec to target Q1 2025, second upgrade with PeerDAS &
EOF to target H2 2025, agree split at ACDC Pectra-devnet-3 : live, validator
consolidations & EIP7702 work as expected and wallet devs can use to test EIP7702
EIP7685 execution layer requests : explicit ordering & handling of invalid requests to
be specified EIP7702 : minimal validity checks, inline with existing transaction types
EIP2537 BLS precompile: MSM precompiles need benchmarking with concurrency disabled to
see if gas cost should be doubled
* Pectra split proposed : overall scope to remain the same, cap Pectra at devnet-3 spec
to target Q1 2025, second upgrade with PeerDAS & EOF to target H2 2025, agree split at
ACDC
Pectra split proposed : overall scope to remain the same, cap Pectra at devnet-3 spec
* Pectra-devnet-3 : live, validator consolidations & EIP7702 work as expected and
wallet devs can use to test EIP7702
Pectra-devnet-3 : live, validator consolidations & EIP7702 work as expected and wallet
devs can use to test EIP7702
* EIP7685 execution layer requests : explicit ordering & handling of invalid requests
to be specified
be specified
* EIP7702 : minimal validity checks, inline with existing transaction types
EIP7702 : minimal validity checks, inline with existing transaction types
* EIP2537 BLS precompile: MSM precompiles need benchmarking with concurrency disabled
to see if gas cost should be doubled
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade
* Pectra testing call #4 : PeerDAS local devnet debugging ongoing
Fusaka (Osaka + Fulu) upgrade
* Verkle implementers call #24 : plan to evaluate binary tries & lean into
tree-agnostic development (in case ZK solution ready in similar timeframe to Verkle),
discussed deletions, EOF/EIP7702 impact and sync
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.2% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.2% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~52% majority
Consensus layer: Prysm 37% Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~52% majority
Execution layer: Geth ~52% majority
* Consensus layer: Prysm 37%
Consensus layer: Prysm 37%
* Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America & Europe
Layer 1
* ePBS breakout #9 : slot auctions give out-of-protocol trusted advantage, new Engine
API method to request payloads by range and discussed moving withdrawals processing to
execution phase
Research
* AUCIL : auction-based inclusion list, aggregator role auctioned off with winner
proposing largest inclusion list
Client Releases
* Execution layer: Erigon v2.60.7 : release process changes & Windows users need to
build locally
* Erigon v2.60.7 : release process changes & Windows users need to build locally
Layer 2
* Optimism Granite upgrade reenabled permissionless fault proofs on OP Mainnet
Optimism Granite upgrade reenabled permissionless fault proofs on OP Mainnet
* OP Succinct : convert OP Stack chain to a zkEVM using SP1, 1 hour finality & ~1 cent
per transaction proving costs
OP Succinct : convert OP Stack chain to a zkEVM using SP1, 1 hour finality & ~1 cent
* ZKsync governance live, consists of token assembly, security council & guardians
ZKsync governance live, consists of token assembly, security council & guardians
* L2 safety : simplified view of L2Beat
L2 safety : simplified view of L2Beat
* RollCall #7 (L2 standards): L2s should shout blobspace needs as PeerDAS may ship
after Pectra, Oasis L2 transaction fee API & status specs and EIP7762 blob minimum
price
RollCall #7 (L2 standards): L2s should shout blobspace needs as PeerDAS may ship after
Pectra, Oasis L2 transaction fee API & status specs and EIP7762 blob minimum price
EIPs/Standards
* RIPs (rollup improvement proposals): RIP7767 : Gas to Ether precompile (GASBACK)
RIPs (rollup improvement proposals):
* RIP7767 : Gas to Ether precompile (GASBACK)
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7765 : Privileged NFTs tied to RWA (ERC721 extension)
ERC7766 : Signature aggregation for account abstraction (ERC4337)
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7765 : Privileged NFTs tied to RWA (ERC721 extension)
ERC7765 : Privileged NFTs tied to RWA (ERC721 extension)
* ERC7766 : Signature aggregation for account abstraction (ERC4337)
Stuff for developers
* EVM Object Format (EOF) explainer : less stack-too-deep errors, lower cost execution,
smaller bytecode and can lead to better tooling
EVM Object Format (EOF) explainer : less stack-too-deep errors, lower cost execution,
* Allegedly : Solidity compiler in TypeScript for EVM simulations
Allegedly : Solidity compiler in TypeScript for EVM simulations
* Moccasin : Vyper contract development framework, uses Python for scripts & tests,
alpha
Moccasin : Vyper contract development framework, uses Python for scripts & tests, alpha
* CTFs: Secureum RACE #32: answers to 8 question Solidity quiz
CTFs:
* Secureum RACE #32: answers to 8 question Solidity quiz
* MEV searcher mines vanity transaction hash prefixes, function selector & call data
Unsuccessful attempt to reverse engineer the contract
MEV searcher mines vanity transaction hash prefixes, function selector & call data
* Unsuccessful attempt to reverse engineer the contract
Security
* Security notes on ERC4337 account abstraction
Ecosystem
* EF EIP4844 data challenge winners
EF EIP4844 data challenge winners
* Hackathon projects: ETHGlobal ETHOnline finalists and ETHWarsaw
Hackathon projects: ETHGlobal ETHOnline finalists and ETHWarsaw
Enterprise
* Visa: stablecoin usage in emerging markets & updated stablecoin dashboard
Visa: stablecoin usage in emerging markets & updated stablecoin dashboard
* EVE Frontier (space survival game) playtest planned on Redstone testnet
EVE Frontier (space survival game) playtest planned on Redstone testnet
Job Listings
* Gnosis seek CoreDevs , Sr Algorithm Engineer , Sr Smart Contract Engineer
Gnosis seek CoreDevs , Sr Algorithm Engineer , Sr Smart Contract Engineer
* Join Witnet as a Community Builder ! Full-time, remote opportunity.
Join Witnet as a Community Builder ! Full-time, remote opportunity.
* Status free.technology is hiring a Business Developer . More jobs at IFT!
Status free.technology is hiring a Business Developer . More jobs at IFT!
* Nomos is hiring Ecosystem Developer , Rust Engineer & Applied Researcher !
Nomos is hiring Ecosystem Developer , Rust Engineer & Applied Researcher !
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
* Fees (via ultrasound.money ): Gas: 0.6 to 28.1 gwei, 3.2 gwei average; zero net
issuance at 24.1 gwei 16k ETH net issuance this week
Fees (via ultrasound.money ):
* Gas: 0.6 to 28.1 gwei, 3.2 gwei average; zero net issuance at 24.1 gwei
Gas: 0.6 to 28.1 gwei, 3.2 gwei average; zero net issuance at 24.1 gwei
* 16k ETH net issuance this week
16k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $2,225 - $2,458, currently $2,437, all time high $4,878
ETHUSD : $2,225 - $2,458, currently $2,437, all time high $4,878
* ETHBTC : currently 0.04 (Flippening at ~0.164)
ETHBTC : currently 0.04 (Flippening at ~0.164)
Notable at app layer
* Coinbase cbBTC live on mainnet & Base; upgradeable, pausable & blacklistable
Coinbase cbBTC live on mainnet & Base; upgradeable, pausable & blacklistable
* PayPal & Venmo add ENS support, use ENS names in search when sending crypto
PayPal & Venmo add ENS support, use ENS names in search when sending crypto
* ZeroDev magic account : chain abstracted USDC on mainnet, Arbitrum, Optimism & Base
ZeroDev magic account : chain abstracted USDC on mainnet, Arbitrum, Optimism & Base
* Snapshot X : onchain voting using Starknet and storage proofs of mainnet holdings
Snapshot X : onchain voting using Starknet and storage proofs of mainnet holdings
* Friend Tech sent contract admin/ownership to zero address
Friend Tech sent contract admin/ownership to zero address
* Fractionalized CryptoPunk bought out for 10 ETH on Niftex (decommissioned platform)
Fractionalized CryptoPunk bought out for 10 ETH on Niftex (decommissioned platform)
Regulation/business/tokens
* US Financial Services subcommittee hearing: decoding DeFi
US Financial Services subcommittee hearing: decoding DeFi
* eToro $1.5M settlement with SEC, US users restricted to trading ETH & Bitcoin SEC
used "crypto asset securities" term despite telling a federal court they would stop
eToro $1.5M settlement with SEC, US users restricted to trading ETH & Bitcoin
* SEC used "crypto asset securities" term despite telling a federal court they would
stop
* Robinhood $3.9M settlement with California DoJ for failing to allow crypto withdrawal
Robinhood $3.9M settlement with California DoJ for failing to allow crypto withdrawal
* Binance employee Tigran Gambaryan still held in Nigeria
Binance employee Tigran Gambaryan still held in Nigeria
General
* Danny Ryan taking an indefinite break from Ethereum L1 R&D
Danny Ryan taking an indefinite break from Ethereum L1 R&D
* Indodax (Indonesian centralized exchange) $25M stolen from hot wallets
Indodax (Indonesian centralized exchange) $25M stolen from hot wallets
* PIXHELL : malicious code can leak info from air gap computers via noise generated by
pixels
PIXHELL : malicious code can leak info from air gap computers via noise generated by
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-september-14-2024
Upcoming Dates of Note

Sep 26-27 â€“ ETHMilan conference

Oct 4-6 â€“ Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
* Oct 4-6 â€“ ETHRome hackathon
Oct 4-6 â€“ ETHRome hackathon
* Oct 17-19 â€“ ETHSofia conference & hackathon
Oct 17-19 â€“ ETHSofia conference & hackathon

Oct 17-20 â€“ ETHLisbon hackathon

Oct 18-20 â€“ ETHGlobal San Francisco hackathon
* Nov 12-15 â€“ Devcon 7 - Southeast Asia (Bangkok)
Nov 12-15 â€“ Devcon 7 - Southeast Asia (Bangkok)
